meanings.definition: To make something tighter or more secure.
meanings.sent1: She used a wrench to tighten the bolt on the table.
meanings.sent2: He tightened his grip on the rope to climb higher.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to tighten its grip on the slippery acorn.
meanings.sent4: The teacher needed to tighten the rules to maintain order in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The screws were loose, so he had to tighten them to fix the chair.

meanings.definition: To become tighter or more secure.
meanings.sent1: The lid started to tighten as she twisted it shut.
meanings.sent2: His muscles began to tighten as he lifted the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The knot in the rope seemed to tighten itself magically.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the tension in the air seemed to tighten.
meanings.sent5: The fabric of the shirt would tighten around his waist after washing it.
